ByteDance now reportedly intends to purchase $14 billion worth of Nvidia‚Äôs $NVDA AI GPUs in 2026, per SCMP, though this is said to be dependent on the H200 approval.

5 Steps to Turn Your Trading Around

The beauty of trading is that every day offers a fresh start. But if you want to improve, you need a reality check. You can‚Äôt keep doing what you‚Äôve been doing. 

You must set your ego aside, assess your performance, and take real action to change. Here are five steps to taking a hard look in the mirror and getting better.

1. Analyze Your Past Year
Start by reviewing your last 12 months of trading data. Log your P&L for each trade, plus your performance by month, week, and day, into a spreadsheet. This shows how well you‚Äôre really doing. A basic P&L number isn‚Äôt enough.

2. Identify the Patterns Behind Your P&L

Dive into the numbers to spot trends. Are you holding losing trades too long? Selling winners too early? Struggling with shorting? Are there specific stocks or sectors where you perform poorly? Are you losing big on options? Asking questions like these reveals the true drivers of your P&L. If you need help, use an AI tool or hire a statistics expert.

3. Break a Single Bad Habit... and Then Another

Your #1 goal should be to eliminate habits that cost you money. It‚Äôs far easier to cut $100,000 in losses from bad decisions than to earn $100,000 in profits. If you lose money on Fed days, stop trading them. If shorting leads to losses, stop shorting. Break one bad habit, then another, and another. Only add new tools to your arsenal once you‚Äôve discarded the bad ones.

4. Build a Daily Routine

Successful traders don‚Äôt wing it‚Äîthey follow a routine they enjoy. If you don‚Äôt enjoy your routine, you‚Äôll never stick to it. Create a checklist of morning tasks, like reading news, scanning charts, and tracking futures. Systemize these to stay focused and avoid distractions like TV or social media. A consistent routine keeps you productive and grounded.

5. Look at Your Life

Trading is intense, so you need to step away to recharge. Pick up a hobby or sport‚Äîrunning, chess, or even video games‚Äîthat demands your full attention. Prioritize your health: eat well, sleep well, and exercise. A healthy mind that makes good decision starts with a healthy body. If you have personal problems, address them. Family or work issues that weigh on your mind will hurt your trading performance. Face them head-on. This never gets discussed in trading circles - but it‚Äôs more important than you can imagine.

If you want more insights from me, make sure you check out my 2x/week trading newsletter:

Trading with Fibonacci and Chop Zone works by combining price retracement zones from Fibonacci with a trend strength filter from Chop Zone. Fibonacci draws key levels where price tends to pause or reverse during pullbacks in a trend, like natural support spots. Chop Zone colors the chart to show clear trends versus choppy sideways action.

RSI (Relative Strength Index) measures the speed and change of price movements to indicate overbought or oversold conditions. MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence) shows trend direction and momentum by comparing moving averages. RSI is best for timing reversals, while MACD is stronger for spotting trend strength and shifts.
